result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam R Kruske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No contact with the victim (R. S.), their family or residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Not to sell any items/materials to any pawn shops.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 30 DAYS:  To be served through Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
Court will allow to be served through Milwaukee County.
Defendant to report to Huber facility by 06:00 p.m. on 05-06-2016.
Balance is STAYED.  To be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Adam R Kruske in court with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.  

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Victim presented a statement in court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  3 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  1.5 Years.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation: 30 Months.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victim (R.S.) the family or residence listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Not to sell any items/materials to any pawn shops.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


CONDITION TIME: 
120 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
First 30 Days to served.
Court will allow to be served through Milwaukee County.
Defendant to report to the huber facility by 6 pm. on 05/06/16
Balance - STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.  


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 2, 2016 at 11:15 am.
